intro: Gireoudia fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed gireoudia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves with a slightly serrated edge. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
